body: $PQEFF Think what you want but each plant that anyone else builds is cost free royalty revenue
created_at: if the top 5 oil sands producers each build one 10k BPD plant in 2 years that is 5 x 10k x 360 days x $80 per barrel x 5% royalty = $72M per year revenue on royalties alone from 1 plant each! Now break that into EPS assuming 800M fully diluted shares is 9 cents per share
column3: and add an aggressive P/E of 30 (not unreasonable based on potential of billions of future barrels to unlock) and you arrive at a stock price of $0.09 x 30 = $2.70
column4: this is with $0 expenses to PQE. If they build the first 5K plant themselves (highly unlikely now that Haywood is looking for a strategic partnership who would likely fund the first plant) their base case EPS on that plant after OPEX of $25 per barrel is earnings net back of very conservative $25 per barrel x 5k x 360 days = $45M or $0.06 cents per share
column5: again a growth P/E of just 30 gives a stock price on 800M shares of $1.80
